DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Slide Greater Than or Equal To Twenty Percent Tumor Cell Nuclei Eligible Histologic Type Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A yes/no response to indicate whether a tumor segment slide meet the acceptance criteria of necrosis ≤20%, total cellularity ≥50%, tumor nuclei ≥20%.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tissue Slide Greater Than or Equal To Twenty Percent Tumor Cell Nuclei Eligible Histologic Type
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted._A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways._A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes._A quantitative measurement of the percent of tumor cell nuclei in a sample compared to the total number of nuclei in the sample._Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted.

Concepts.definition: A slide on which a tissue section has been mounted.

Property.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To Twenty Percent Tumor Cell Nuclei Eligible Histologic Type
Property.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.:A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes.:A quantitative measurement of the percent of tumor cell nuclei in a sample compared to the total number of nuclei in the sample.:Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion.:Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A natural number greater than nineteen and less than twenty-one and the quantity that it denotes.
A quantitative measurement of the percent of tumor cell nuclei in a sample compared to the total number of nuclei in the sample.
Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion.
Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Abnormalities that occur in human cells and tissues and models of human cancer.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/6/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review CRF.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: This slide meets required acc
ReferenceDocuments.description: This slide meets required acceptance criteria (histologic type eligible, necrosis ≤20%, total cellularity ≥50%, tumor nuclei ≥20%)

DataElement.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElement.changeDescription: 7/12/21 jk added HNSCC Path Rpt CSI in error. 2/13/20 jk RS chg to Qualified.  1/22/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/8/20 jk created for CPTAC Path Review and Local Path CRFs; applicable to PRAD tumor types.
